conclusion: Find the time t for light to travel from point O to AB boundary in a trapezoid with refractive index √2.
Right-angled trapezoid ABDE with AB parallel to DE and AE perpendicular to AB.
Light enters the trapezoid at O and travels to AB.
Snell's Law: n1 sin θ1 = n2 sin θ2, with n1 = 1 (air) and n2 = √2 (medium).
Using Snell's Law: sin 45° = √2 sin θ2.
Calculate θ2: sin θ2 = 1/2, so θ2 = 30°.
Path length L inside the medium is h/cos θ2.
Speed of light in vacuum c is approximately 3 x 10^8 m/s.
Speed of light in the medium v = c/√2.
Time t to travel distance L is t = L/v.
Substitute L and v: t = (2h/√3) / (3 x 10^8/√2).
Simplify expression for t: t = 2h√6 / (9 x 10^8).
Final expression for time t is 2h√6 / (9 x 10^8) seconds.
